jx.jx_en_mean: maintain a feeling of ill will or resentment towards someone

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: variant of obsolete grutch 'complain, murmur, grumble', from Old French grouchier, of unknown origin. Compare with grouch

entry.def: If you have or bear a grudge against someone, you have unfriendly feelings towards them because of something they did in the past.

example.ex: He appears to have a grudge against certain players...
example.tran: 他看来对某些选手怀恨在心。

example.ex: There is no doubt it was an accident and I bear no grudges.
example.tran: 这无疑是个意外，我没有怨言。

means.word_mean: 1. a resentment strong enough to justify retaliation;
1. bear a grudge; harbor ill feelings

auth_sentence.content: The Hatters have held a grudge ever since.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Hatters have held a grudge ever since.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Hatters have held a grudge ever since.

auth_sentence.content: He did not grudge the expatriate engineers their fatter pay-packets.
auth_sentence.res_content: He did not grudge the expatriate engineers their fatter pay-packets.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He did not grudge the expatriate engineers their fatter pay-packets.

auth_sentence.content: I will feed fat the ancient grudge I bear him.
auth_sentence.res_content: I will feed fat the ancient grudge I bear him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I will feed fat the ancient grudge I bear him.

means.word_mean: 不满, 怨恨, 妒忌,积怨，嫌隙

sentences.en: He has been harbouring a grudge against me.
I know Leslie will forgive me, because she is not the type of person to hold a grudge.
sentences.cn: 我知道蕾丝莉会原谅我，因为她不是个会记仇的人。

means.word_mean: 勉强给(或允许), 不情愿做,吝惜

sentences.en: I grudge paying so much for such inferior goods.
sentences.cn: 我不愿花这么多钱买次品。

jushi.chinese: 我认为他的成功是应该的。

jushi.english: He grudges every penny he has to spend.
jushi.chinese: 他吝惜他不得不花的每一分钱。

jushi.english: There is no one who grudges to help her.
